description: I think it is better, if it would have the volume button.

I have being using this music player on my Elementary OS hera for about 1 year and never had any issues and for this reason I also use on my desktop running Fedora 33 with out any problems! it's just PERFECT 
thank you to the creator and maintainer for this application
Thanks for making this available on Fedora. GNOME music is barely usable and Lollypop keeps crashing.
The fact that it actually launches when set as a default program, unlike Rhythmbox, makes it better than the competition. I don't know what else to say. It looks nice?

I have loved this app since it's conception. However, to this day, it cannot properly scan a medium-large music library without taking a really long time, or crashing my system... I've tried it on several computers, even while using Elementary proper.
summary: Very Aesthetic, Slow for Big Libraries

description:
You cannot even reduce the volume inside the application. 
In order to organize your music you need plenty of time. You need to import them to library and then move them to your play list while the library is so messed up.
Music looks great, but it's pretty much unusable if you have a huge library as it takes forever to load your library.
basically folder view is what most prefer for offline rather than tags
summary: If it has a folderview that would be great

description: Me gusta bastante, la interfaz es muy amigable y tiene funciones buenas.
Incorpora una interfaz limpia y funciones amplias. La reproduccion es buena, incluye ecualizador y una forma sencilla de organizar la biblioteca de música.
